Hollywood needs to produce a certain amount of movies to meet a quota for the theaters. No movies means nobody goes to the theaters. So to fill seats, they pump out 'formulaic' movies every year. You get your 'romantic comedies', your 'war movies', etc.. 
And then you get shit like this. Adam Sandler will continue to make movies unless someone stops him. *NOTICE*: He must be stopped! Please, someone tell him that his movies are truly horrible. Anyone!

Making a "playing-a-dude-and-a chick-in-the-same-movie"- movie is the saddest thing a comedian can do. The only person in history to star in one of those with some credibility was Dustin Hoffman in Tootsie in 1982. I guess it takes a classically trained actor to pull it off, because every time a comedian does it it's just oh... so sad.

*RUSH  how can u stereo type an entire nation of 55 million ppl, u r pathetic slating britain when u clearly have no idea what its like. unlike america britain isnt under martial law and we dont have FEMA camps set up all over the country ready to send the cattle (the american ppl) to!
Jewish shit.

@tiz2 but dustin hoffman was never playing two characters at the same time, except maybe in that scene with the pie on his face :-)  And what about Eddie Murphy? I didn't enjoy that either, I might give this one a miss too
Ahh, that was Robin Williams in Mrs Doubtfire (pie on the face)... Seems there's been a few of these movies :-)

leftdeffer - yes he does make really bad movies. But "punch drunk love" shows he can be used with skill and brilliance. It's a shame there just isn't enough money to support good writers and directors. If HOLLYWOOD could just pay thes "actors a few million dollars less per movie' they could put the money into funding more writers to put these overpaid actors to work. Perhaps we would go back to seing the movies at the cinema.

@[deleted]: ... Martin Lawrence, The Wayans Brothers, Arsenio Hall... The list is way too long for a concept that should never have been. Mrs. Doubtfire was (awful) the same concept, dude pretending to be a chick, not a dude playing a chick. Eddie Murphy hasn't actually made a movie like this, but has played a male and female character in at least 3 movies, and is the only one mentioned to appear as both in the same scene :P
